poem:
Title: "The Aria of Mundane Politics"

In the grand opera of Europe,
Prime ministers, like tenors, step into the spotlight,
Warbling of peace, unequal markets, and elusive dreams.
Each a Don Giovanni clothed in a suit,
Dancing through the notes of Ukraine, Turkey, the Middle East.
Maltese chords echo, spanning seas and summit,
The overture to another day, where tomorrow's curtain
Rises on the same stage, teeming with varied voices.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Europe live: EU leaders meet to discuss Ukraine, the Middle East and the economy 3.45pm BST “Malta will continue to advocate for peace & equal access to the Single Market for all European citizens,” the Maltese prime minister, Robert Abela, said ahead of today’s meeting. In Brussels for #EUCO Summit. Key talks on economy & competitiveness issues, Ukraine, Turkey & the Middle East. 🇲🇹 will continue to advocate for peace & equal access to the". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
